content: Hey all, I said that I would go over the rust-lang-nursery project checklist -- but can someone remind me where it is located?
@nikomatsakis https://hackmd.io/wdJIYSUCTCWKoAfu3y8Q0w?both
OK, so, looking through the list
I'm just going to drop some notes here
since i'm not sure where else to put them :)
• error-chain -- older crate, largely deprecated at this point though still in use -- what do we do with old, deprecated packages? we should do that. =)
• rust-toolstate -- afaik this bit of infra is still in use. @Pietro Albini or @simulacrum might know more. Probably we should migate to rust-lang org
yes, toolstate is still used, we can likely move it without too much problem

• rust-cookbook -- I'm not sure what's going on here, still seems to be at least somewhat maintained... probably should move to rust-lang, but it'd be nice to have some idea of what team etc is manging it
libs team :)
• lazy-static.rs -- this is still pretty broadly used, should move to rust-lang I imagine, manage by libs team?
• rustc-perf -- this is part of infra, @simulacrum probably the owner :)
• cli-wg -- I think we created a gh org for cli wg..can maybe move there?
• rustc-timing -- is this repo still gathering data, @simulacrum ?
• failure -- similar to error chain, more or less deprecated afaik, @boats could confirm
both timing and perf are being used, can be moved over without too much hassle, I just haven't gotten around to it
• pin-utils -- no idea about this, maybe @Taylor Cramer can say if this is still relevant? I expect "probably"
I'll skip ahead a bit
• ena -- ownd by compiler team, I should move this
• https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/thanks -- was archived, probably fine as is
• rust-lang-nursery/gll -- I think @eddyb is main maintainer? interesting question. could move to rust-lang I suppose, or maybe to its own GH org? I guess it depends on status of grammar WG
• rustc-seme-regions -- was created by me, can be archived I think
• futures-rfcs -- maybe we can move the content into the new rust-lang/wg-async-foundations repo

pin-utils -- no idea about this, maybe @Taylor Cramer can say if this is still relevant? I expect "probably"

Yes, it is.
Happy to go into more detail if it's wanted, but TL;DR it provides a bunch of handy pinning-related macros that are safer / encapsulate unsafety
They're used pretty heavily in the futures-rs crate

cli-wg -- I think we created a gh org for cli wg..can maybe move there?

We already moved that repo to CLI WG org that repo is just there for redirects.
